fields.headline: Former Surrey spinner  Eric Bedser dies aged 87
fields.bodyText: Eric Bedser, the twin who did not play for England but otherwise was inseparable from his brother Alec, died yesterday aged 87. He had been in poor health for some time. Alec, a seamer who was capped 51 times, and Eric, a spinner, made their first-class debuts in the same match for Surrey in June 1939. Eric played a season longer before retiring in 1961, topped 1,000 runs in a season six times and took more than 800 wickets. The twins served in the second world war together ran a stationery company, Straker Ryman, and shared a bungalow in Woking. Their final appearance at a Test match together was at The Oval last summer for the fifth Test against Australia.
